justification: “Hopstaken et al. (2015) observed changes in task performance … and self-reports of fatigue.”
The same Hopstaken et al. sentence notes that physiological states indexed by “P3 amplitude” changed with mental fatigue.
Hopstaken et al. (2015) list “pupil diameter” among the physiological indicators that varied with mental fatigue.
The article reports that task performance “measured in d-prime” declined as fatigue increased, using d′ as an index of mental fatigue.
“In an office work environment … mental fatigue has been observed to reduce both typewriting speed and accuracy (de Jong et al., 2020),” implying these performance metrics operationalise fatigue.
